---
title: "export_all_namespaces.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file contains test data for exporting all namespaces in a feature flag management system. It defines multiple namespaces, each with associated flags and segments, representing a complex configuration for feature flag management across different environments or contexts.

## Code Structure
The file consists of multiple JSON objects, each representing a namespace or the version information. The objects are separated by newlines, forming a JSON Lines (JSONL) format.

## Symbols

### Version Object
#### Description
Specifies the version of the data format used in the file.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | The version number of the data format |

### Namespace Object
#### Description
Defines a namespace, which is a container for flags and segments.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the namespace |
| name | string | Display name of the namespace |
| description | string | Brief description of the namespace |

### Flag Object
#### Description
Represents a feature flag with its configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name of the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is currently enabled |
| variants | array | List of variants for variant flags |
| rules | array | List of rules for flag evaluation |
| rollouts | array | List of rollout configurations for boolean flags |

### Segment Object
#### Description
Defines a segment of users or entities for targeted flag evaluation.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name of the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the segment |
| constraints | array | List of constraints defining the segment |

## Internal Logic
The file defines three namespaces: "default", "foo", and "bar". Each namespace (except "default") contains flags and segments with complex configurations:

1. Variant flags with multiple variants and rules.
2. Boolean flags with rollout configurations.
3. Segments with constraints for user targeting.

The "foo" and "bar" namespaces have identical configurations, likely for testing purposes.

## Dependencies
This file does not directly depend on external libraries, but it represents data that would be consumed by a feature flag management system.

## Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for a feature flag system, defining namespaces, flags, and segments.

## API/Interface Reference
While not an API itself, this file represents data that could be used in an API for feature flag management. The structure implies the following endpoints might exist in a related system:

| Endpoint | Method | Description |
|:---------|:-------|:------------|
| /namespaces | GET | Retrieve all namespaces |
| /namespaces/{key}/flags | GET | Retrieve flags for a specific namespace |
| /namespaces/{key}/segments | GET | Retrieve segments for a specific namespace |

This file serves as test data for these potential endpoints, providing a complex scenario with multiple namespaces, flags, and segments for thorough testing of a feature flag management system.
